title: PHPmin()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPmin()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Find lowest value with the min() function: "); echo(min(22,14,68,18,15) . "
"); echo(min(array(4,6,8,10)) . "
"); echo(min(array(44,16,81,12))); ?> Definition and Usage The min() function returns the lowest value in an array, or the lowest value of several specified values. Syntax min( array_values ); or min( value1,value2,... ); Parameter Values Parameter Description array_values Required. Specifies an array containing the values value1,value2,... Required. Specifies the values to compare (must be at least two values) Technical Details Return Value: The numerically lowest value Return Type: Mixed PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPmin()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPmin()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPmin()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
